info.title: Daraa
info.description: This data store is offered by CubeWerx Inc. as a demonstration of its in-progress OGC API implementation.

servers.description: OGC API for the "Daraa" data store

get.summary: The OGC API landing page for this data store.
The set of OGC API conformance classes that are supported for this data store.
The set of collections available in this data store.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to present in the response document.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index within the result set from which the server will begin presenting results in the response document.  If offset is greater or equal to the number of items in the result set, the server will return an empty list.

get.summary: A collection available in this data store.

parameters.name: collectionId
parameters.description: The identifier of a collection in this data store.

get.summary: The set of collections available in this data store, organized into a theme hierarchy (see OGC 18-045, section A.6).

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Experimental.  If "full", the complete collection objects are returned.  If "refsOnly", only references to the collections are returned.  If "idsOnly", only the collection IDs are returned.

get.summary: The schema of one or more collections.

parameters.name: collections
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of collection identifiers.  If omitted, the schema of all of the relevant collections will be returned.

get.summary: The schema of a collection.

parameters.name: collectionId
parameters.description: The identifier of a collection in this data store.

get.summary: This operation retreives features from the specified collection

parameters.name: collectionId
parameters.description: Name of a feature collection offered by the service

parameters.name: f
parameters.description: A MIME type indicating the representation of the resources to be presented (e.g. application/gml+xml; version=3.2 for GML 3.2).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
The optional limit parameter limits the number of items that are presented in the response document.  Only items are counted that are on the first level of the collection in
the response document. Nested objects contained within the explicitly requested items shall not be counted.

parameters.name: bbox
parameters.description: Only features that have a geometry that intersects the bounding box are selected. The bounding box is provided as four or six numbers, depending on whether the coordinate reference system includes a vertical axis (elevation or depth): * Lower left corner, coordinate axis 1 * Lower left corner, coordinate axis 2 * Lower left corner, coordinate axis 3 (optional) * Upper right corner, coordinate axis 1 * Upper right corner, coordinate axis 2 * Upper right corner, coordinate axis 3 (optional) The coordinate reference system of the values is WGS84 longitude/latitude (http://www.opengis.net/def/crs/OGC/1.3/CRS84) unless a different coordinate reference system is specified in the parameter `bbox-crs`. For WGS84 longitude/latitude the values are in most cases the sequence of minimum longitude, minimum latitude, maximum longitude and maximum latitude. However, in cases where the box spans the antimeridian the first value (west-most box edge) is larger than the third value (east-most box edge). If a feature has multiple spatial geometry properties, it is the decision of the server whether only a single spatial geometry property is used to determine the extent or all relevant geometries.

parameters.name: datetime
parameters.description: Temporal constraint to be applied to a query; may be a time instance or a temporal period as per ISO8601.

parameters.name: tRelation
parameters.description: Temporal operator to use for temporal contstraint

parameters.name: resultType
parameters.description: The possible values for this parameter are "results" and "hits". If the value of the resultType parameter is set to "results" the server shall generate a complete response document containing resources that satisfy the operation. The root element of the response container shall include a count of the number of resources actually presented in the response document. The root element of the response container shall also include a count of the total number of resources that the operations actually found which will always be equal to or greater than the number of resource presented in the response document. If the value of the resultType attribute is set to "hits" the server shall generate an empty response document containing no resource instances and the root element of the response container shall contain the count of the total number of resources that the operation found. The value for the number of resources presented in the response document shall be set to zero.

parameters.name: propertyName
parameters.description: A list of feature properties to include in the response.  For some output formats, such as XML that can be validate against a formal schema, this list represents the optional properties to include in the response.

parameters.name: coordPrecision
parameters.description: Number of digits after the decimal point to use when presenting result in a text-base output format such as XML or JSON

parameters.name: css
parameters.description: A reference to a CSS to be applied to HTML-based output formats; ignored otherwise

parameters.name: xslt
parameters.description: A reference to a XSLT to be applied to XML-based output formats; ignored otherwise

parameters.name: kmlStyleURL
parameters.description: A reference to a KML style shere to be applied to KML-based output formats; ignored otherwise

parameters.name: maxBytes
parameters.description: The maximum number of bytes to be presented in one page of a query response.

parameters.name: resolution
parameters.description: Specifies the resolution of a display port in the event that the WFS output is intended for display; the server attempts to simplify each output geometry by removing unnecessary verticies and this triming the size of the response.

parameters.name: responseHandler
parameters.description: Tiggers asynchronous processing of the request; notification is sent to the endpoint specified as the value of the parameter.

parameters.name: crs
parameters.description: Asserts the CRS to use for encoding features in the response document.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: A query filter specified is some predicate encoding language supported by the server

parameters.name: filter_language
parameters.description: An identifier indicating the predicate language used to express the value of the "filter" parameter

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: A space seperated list of search terms to be applied to text fields in a feature.

parameters.name: geometry
parameters.description: The geometry of an area of interest specified using WKT.

parameters.name: geometry_crs
parameters.description: The CRS used to encode the coordinates of the "geometry" parameter.

parameters.name: relation
parameters.description: The spatial operator to apply when testing a feature's geometry against the area of interest encoded using the "geometry" parameter.

parameters.name: lat
parameters.description: The latitude of the center point of a proximity search.

parameters.name: lon
parameters.description: The longitude of the center point of a proximity search.

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: The search radius in meters of a proximity search.

parameters.name: collectionId
parameters.description: The identifier of a collection in this data store.

get.summary: The set of styles available in this data store.

post.summary: Add a new style to this data store, or just validate a style.

requestBody.description: The definition of an OGG-API style.  There are two ways of representing such a style in SLD.  The first is by using a SymLayerSet with one or more NamedLayers, each of which defines exactly one UserStyle (whose name is the ID of the style being defined), each of which has exactly one FeatureTypeStyle (whose FeatureTypeName is implicitly or explicitly the same as that of the NamedLayer).  The second is by using a UserStyle (as a top-level element) with one or more FeatureTypeStyles, each of which explicitly specifies a FeatureTypeName indicating the collection that that FeatureTypeStyle is for.  Either way, the style must not already exist, and all referenced collections must exist and be of a compatible type.

get.summary: A style in this data store.

parameters.name: styleId
parameters.description: The identifier of a style in this data store.

put.summary: Add a new style to this data store, redefine an existing style, or just validate a style.

parameters.name: styleId
parameters.description: The identifier of a (new or existing) style in this data store.

requestBody.description: The definition of an OGG-API style.  There are two ways of representing such a style in SLD.  The first is by using a SymLayerSet with one or more NamedLayers, each of which defines exactly one UserStyle (whose name is the ID of the style being defined), each of which has exactly one FeatureTypeStyle (whose FeatureTypeName is implicitly or explicitly the same as that of the NamedLayer).  The second is by using a UserStyle (as a top-level element) with one or more FeatureTypeStyles, each of which explicitly specifies a FeatureTypeName indicating the collection that that FeatureTypeStyle is for.  Either way, all referenced collections must exist and be of the compatible type.  If this style already exists, its definition will get updated on the server.  Otherwise it will get created on the server.

204.description: The resource has been updated, created or validated.

delete.summary: Remove a style from this data store.

parameters.name: styleId
parameters.description: The identifier of a style in this data store.

get.summary: A legend image showing a graphical representation of the specified style, broken down by each of the collections that it's capable of rendering.

parameters.name: styleId
parameters.description: The identifier of a style in this data store.

get.summary: A map layer consisting of one or more collections.

parameters.name: geodata
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of collection identifiers indicating the collections to be rendered.  Each of the specified collections must be renderable in the specified style.  The leftmost collection in the list will be rendered bottommost, the next one over that, and so on.  In the absence of a geodata parameter, all of the collections that are renderable in specified style are rendered, in the order that the server deems most appropriate.

parameters.name: styleId
parameters.description: The identifier of a style in this data store.  If no geodata parameter is present, all of the collections that are renderable in this style are rendered in this style.  If a geodata parameter is present, all of the specified collections must be renderable in the specified style.  If no styleId parameter is present, the default style of each of the specified collections (or of all mappable collections in the absence of a geodata parameter) will be rendered.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: The width (in pixels) of the map.  If unspecified, a reasonable default will be used.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The height (in pixels) of the map.  If unspecified, a reasonable default will be used.

parameters.description: A comma-separated list of collection identifiers indicating the collections to be rendered.  Each of the specified collections must be renderable in the specified style.  The leftmost collection in the list will be rendered bottommost, the next one over that, and so on.  In the absence of a geodata parameter, all of the collections that are renderable in specified style are rendered, in the order that the server deems most appropriate.

parameters.name: styleId

parameters.description: The identifier of a tile-matrix set that this collection is available in.

parameters.name: f
parameters.description: A token indicating the content type to return.  Overrides the HTTP "Accept" header if present.  A value of "wkb" (content type "application/x-cubewerx-wkb") indicates CubeWerx's raster extension to the Well-Known-Binary format.  "mvt" and "geojson" can only be requested for feature collections, and "tiff" and "wkb" can only be requested for coverage collections.

collectionInfo-json.title: Collection Information Schema (JSON)
collectionInfo-json.description: This schema defines the JSON metadata resource returned from the /collections/{collectionId} endpoint.

title.description: A human readable title of the collection.

description.description: A description of the members of the collection.

itemType.description: An indicator about the type of the items in the collection.

storageCrs.description: The coordinate reference system that may be used to retrieve features from this collection without the need to apply a CRS transformation.

crs.description: The list of coordinate reference systems supported by the API.  The first item is the default coordinate reference system.

collectionInfo-xml.title: Collection Information Schema (XML)
collectionInfo-xml.description: This schema defines the XML resource returned from the /collections/{collectionId} endpoint.

collections-json.title: Collections Schema (JSON)
collections-json.description: This schema defines the JSON metadata resource returned from the /collections endpoint.

collections-xml.title: Collections Schema (JSON)
collections-xml.description: This schema defines the JSON resource returned from the /collections endpoint.

conformance-json.title: Conformance Classes Schema (JSON)
conformance-json.description: This schema defines the JSON resource returned from the /conformance endpoint.

conformsTo.description: An array of URLs, where each URL corresponds to a defined OGC Conformance class.  Unrecognized URLs should be ignored.

conformance-xml.title: Conformance Classes Schema (XML)
conformance-xml.description: This schema defines the XML resource returned from the /conformance endpoint.

crs.description: Coordinate reference system of the coordinates in the spatial extent (property `spatial`).  In the Core, only WGS84 longitude/latitude is supported.  Extensions may support additional coordinate reference systems.

temporal.description: Begin and end times of the temporal extent.

trs.description: Temporal reference system of the coordinates in the temporal extent (property `temporal`).  In the Core, only the Gregorian calendar is supported.  Extensions may support additional temporal reference systems.

landingPage-json.title: Landing Page Schema (JSON)
landingPage-json.description: JSON schema for the OGC API - Common landing page.

description.description: A textual description of the API

attribution.description: An attribution for the API.  It should be short and intended for presentation to a user, for example, in a corner of a map.  Parts of the text can be links to other resources if additional information is needed.  The string can include HTML markup.

links.description: Links to the resources exposed through this API.

landingPage-xml.title: Landing Page Schema (XML)
landingPage-xml.description: This schema defines the XML response of the OGC API-Common landing page.

styleSet.description: This schema defines the JSON resource returned from the /styles endpoint.

theme-json.title: Theme Schema (JSON)
theme-json.description: This schema defines the JSON metadata resource representing a theme.

themes-json.title: Themes Schema (JSON)
themes-json.description: This schema defines the JSON metadata resource returned from the /themes endpoint, providing the set of top-level themes and collections.

alphaChannel.name: alphaChannel
alphaChannel.description: Whether or not the GeoTIFF should include an alpha channel (as apposed to a GDAL NODATA tag) to indicate areas of no data.  The default value depends on the type of the coverage.  For numeric types, the NODATA tag is well-defined and interoperable, and is likely what most coverage clients will expect, so a default value of false will be used.  For color types, however, the NODATA tag is ill-defined and not interoperable, so a default value of true will be used.

bbox-coverage.name: bbox
bbox-coverage.description:
Specifies a subset of the coverage using a bounding box.
The bounding box is provided as four or six numbers, depending on whether the
coordinate reference system includes a vertical axis (elevation or depth):

* Lower left corner, coordinate axis 1
* Lower left corner, coordinate axis 2
* Lower left corner, coordinate axis 3 (optional)
* Upper right corner, coordinate axis 1
* Upper right corner, coordinate axis 2
* Upper right corner, coordinate axis 3 (optional)

The coordinate reference system of the values is WGS 84 longitude/latitude
(http://www.opengis.net/def/crs/OGC/1.3/CRS84) unless a different coordinate
reference system is specified by the 'bbox-crs' parameter.

For WGS 84 longitude/latitude the values are in most cases the sequence of
minimum longitude, minimum latitude, maximum longitude and maximum latitude.
However, in cases where the box spans the antimeridian the first value
(west-most box edge) is larger than the third value (east-most box edge).

bbox-crs.name: bbox-crs
bbox-crs.description: The coordinate reference system of the specified bbox.

bbox.name: bbox
bbox.description:
Only elements that have a geometry that intersects the bounding box are selected.
The bounding box is provided as four or six numbers, depending on whether the
coordinate reference system includes a vertical axis (elevation or depth):

* Lower left corner, coordinate axis 1
* Lower left corner, coordinate axis 2
* Lower left corner, coordinate axis 3 (optional)
* Upper right corner, coordinate axis 1
* Upper right corner, coordinate axis 2
* Upper right corner, coordinate axis 3 (optional)

The coordinate reference system of the values is WGS 84 longitude/latitude
(http://www.opengis.net/def/crs/OGC/1.3/CRS84) unless a different coordinate
reference system is specified by the 'bbox-crs' parameter.

For WGS 84 longitude/latitude the values are in most cases the sequence of
minimum longitude, minimum latitude, maximum longitude and maximum latitude.
However, in cases where the box spans the antimeridian the first value
(west-most box edge) is larger than the third value (east-most box edge).

If an element has multiple spatial geometry properties, it is the decision of the
server whether only a single spatial geometry property is used to determine
the extent or all relevant geometries.

bgcolor.name: bgcolor
bgcolor.description: Hexadecimal red-green-blue color value for the background color.  If not specified, the background color specified by the style (0xFFFFFF by default) will be used.

coverageBbox.name: bbox
coverageBbox.description:
Specifies a subset of the coverage using a bounding box (as an alternative to using the subset parameter).
The bounding box is provided as four or six numbers, depending on whether the
coordinate reference system includes a vertical axis (elevation or depth):

* Lower left corner, coordinate axis 1
* Lower left corner, coordinate axis 2
* Lower left corner, coordinate axis 3 (optional)
* Upper right corner, coordinate axis 1
* Upper right corner, coordinate axis 2
* Upper right corner, coordinate axis 3 (optional)

The coordinate reference system of the values is WGS 84 longitude/latitude
(http://www.opengis.net/def/crs/OGC/1.3/CRS84) unless a different coordinate
reference system is specified by the 'bbox-crs' parameter.

For WGS 84 longitude/latitude the values are in most cases the sequence of
minimum longitude, minimum latitude, maximum longitude and maximum latitude.
However, in cases where the box spans the antimeridian the first value
(west-most box edge) is larger than the third value (east-most box edge).

coverageHeight.name: height
coverageHeight.description: The number of samples high to scale the requested coverage subset to.  This is an alternative to using the scaleSize parameter.

coverageWidth.name: width
coverageWidth.description: The number of samples wide to scale the requested coverage subset to.  This is an alternative to using the scaleSize parameter.

datetime.name: datetime
datetime.description:
Either a date-time or an interval, open or closed. Date and time expressions adhere to RFC 3339.  Open intervals are expressed using double-dots.

Examples:

* A date-time: "2018-02-12T23:20:50Z"
* A closed interval: "2018-02-12T00:00:00Z/2018-03-18T12:31:12Z"
* Open intervals: "2018-02-12T00:00:00Z/.." or "../2018-03-18T12:31:12Z"

Only elements that have a temporal property that intersects the value of `datetime` are selected.

f-geotiffHtml.name: f
f-geotiffHtml.description: A token indicating the content type to return.  Overrides the HTTP "Accept" header if present.

f-jsonHtml.name: f
f-jsonHtml.description: A token indicating the content type to return.  Overrides the HTTP "Accept" header if present.

f-jsonSldHtml.name: f
f-jsonSldHtml.description: A token indicating the content type to return.  Overrides the HTTP "Accept" header if present.

f-jsonXmlHtml.name: f
f-jsonXmlHtml.description: A token indicating the content type to return.  Overrides the HTTP "Accept" header if present.

f-mapImage.name: f
f-mapImage.description: A token indicating the content type to return.  Overrides the HTTP "Accept" header if present.  A value of "jop" (content type "image/x-jpegorpng") indicates that either JPEG or PNG should be returned, whichever the server deems to be most appropriate for this particular image.  A value of "wkb" indicates CubeWerx's raster extension to the Well-Known-Binary format.

f-sldstyleHtml.name: f
f-sldstyleHtml.description: A token indicating the content type to return.  Overrides the HTTP "Accept" header if present.  If "sld11" or "sld10" is specified, the style is returned as a SymLayerSet with one or more NamedLayers, each of which defines exactly one UserStyle (whose name is the ID of the style being defined), each of which has exactly one FeatureTypeStyle (whose FeatureTypeName is implicitly or explicitly the same as that of the NamedLayer).  If "sld11style" or "sld10style" is specified, the style is returned as a UserStyle (as a top-level element) with one or more FeatureTypeStyles, each of which explicitly specifies a FeatureTypeName indicating the collection that that FeatureTypeStyle is for.

f-stacHtml.name: f
f-stacHtml.description: A token indicating the content type to return.  Overrides the HTTP "Accept" header if present.

f-style.name: f
f-style.description: A token indicating the content type to return.  Overrides the HTTP "Accept" header if present.  If "json" is specified, a metadata document is returned.  If "sld11" or "sld10" is specified, the style is returned as a SymLayerSet with one or more NamedLayers, each of which defines exactly one UserStyle (whose name is the ID of the style being defined), each of which has exactly one FeatureTypeStyle (whose FeatureTypeName is implicitly or explicitly the same as that of the NamedLayer).  If "sld11style" or "sld10style" is specified, the style is returned as a UserStyle (as a top-level element) with one or more FeatureTypeStyles, each of which explicitly specifies a FeatureTypeName indicating the collection that that FeatureTypeStyle is for.

imageId.name: imageId
imageId.description: The identifier of a source image in this collection.

map-bbox.name: bbox
map-bbox.description: The spatial extent of the map in crs units.  Syntax: "minx,miny,maxx,maxy".  If present, the crs parameter must also be present.  If not present, the extent and native coordinate reference system of the thing being mapped will be used.

map-crs.name: crs
map-crs.description: The coordinate reference system of the map.  If present, the bbox parameter must also be present.  If not present, the extent and native coordinate reference system of the thing being mapped will be used.

pixelSize.name: pixelSize
pixelSize.description: The physical linear size of a display pixel in millimetres.  If the display device has non-square pixels, then sqrt(width * height) should be provided.  The pixel units and scale rules in a style definition are with respect to a standardized rendering pixel size of 0.28mm.  Knowledge of the actual pixel size of the display device will allow the renderer to produce a map with the intended look even if the actual pixel size is significantly different from the standardized rendering pixel size.

pretty.name: pretty
pretty.description: Whether or not the output should be pretty-formatted (with whitespace, etc.).

removeFromFilesystem.name: removeFromFilesystem
removeFromFilesystem.description: Whether or not the source image (and its auxiliary files, if any) should be removed from the filesystem.  Specify as true only if you know that this source image isn't also registered with another collection.  The default value is true if the source image is in the filesystem directory that an HTTP POST request to the images endpoint places source images in, and false otherwise.

responseHandler.name: responseHandler
responseHandler.description: If this parameter is present, the client will receive an immediate acknowledgement response (with an HTTP status of 202), and the preparation of the coverage will be performed offline.  When the coverage is ready (or if an error occurs), the client will be informed via the specified response handler.  This provides the ability to request a coverage that would normally be too large or take too long to be handled within the confines of an HTTP request.  Currently the only supported response handler scheme is "mailto:" (e.g., "mailto:me@myaddress.com".

scale-axes.name: scale-axes
scale-axes.description: See Requirement 20 of the "OGC Web Coverage Service Interface Standard - Scaling Extension" (OGC 12-039).

scale-extent.name: scale-extent
scale-extent.description: See Requirement 22 of the "OGC Web Coverage Service Interface Standard - Scaling Extension" (OGC 12-039).

scale-factor.name: scale-factor
scale-factor.description: A scale factor to be applied to all coverage axes.  A value of 1 leaves the coverage unscaled, a value between 0 and 1 scales down (reduces target domain), and a value greater than 1 scales up (enlarges target domain).

scale-size.name: scale-size
scale-size.description: See Requirement 21 of the "OGC Web Coverage Service Interface Standard - Scaling Extension" (OGC 12-039).

scale.name: scale
scale.description: If specified, a legend graphic specific to this scale (expressed as a scale denominator) will be returned.  Otherwise, a possibly-composite image providing a legend graphic for each of the scale ranges defined by the style will be returned.

scaleAxes.name: scaleAxes
scaleAxes.description: See Requirement 20 of the "OGC Web Coverage Service Interface Standard - Scaling Extension" (OGC 12-039).

scaleExtent.name: scaleExtent
scaleExtent.description: See Requirement 22 of the "OGC Web Coverage Service Interface Standard - Scaling Extension" (OGC 12-039).

scaleFactor.name: scaleFactor
scaleFactor.description: A scale factor to be applied to all coverage axes.  A value of 1 leaves the coverage unscaled, a value between 0 and 1 scales down (reduces target domain), and a value greater than 1 scales up (enlarges target domain).

scaleSize.name: scaleSize
scaleSize.description: See Requirement 21 of the "OGC Web Coverage Service Interface Standard - Scaling Extension" (OGC 12-039).

subset.name: subset
subset.description: Specifies a subset of the coverage along one or more axes.  See the "OGC API - Coverages - Part 1: Core" specification for a description of the syntax.

textcolor.name: textcolor
textcolor.description: Hexadecimal red-green-blue color value for the text color.  If not specified, a color that contrasts the background color will be used.

tileCol.name: tileCol
tileCol.description: The zero-based column index of the tile in the specified tile matrix.

tileMatrix.name: tileMatrix
tileMatrix.description: The identifier of a tile matrix (typically a zoom level) within the specified tile-matrix set.

tileRow.name: tileRow
tileRow.description: The zero-based row index of the tile in the specified tile matrix.

transform.name: transform
transform.description: Specifies one or more transformations to apply.  See the CubeWerx Suite product documentation for details.

transparent.name: transparent
transparent.description: Whether or not the background of the image should be transparent (when supported by the requested image format).

updateTiles.name: updateTiles
updateTiles.description: Whether or not the map tiles should be updated.  Typically this is desired, but if multiple updates to the same collection are being performed serially, it's more efficient to specify updateTiles=false for all but the final update.

validate.name: validate
validate.description: Whether or not to validate (or only validate) the style.  A value of "yes" validates the style before creating it on the server (returning code 201 on successful creation and code 400 if validation fails), a value of "no" creates the style without validation (although some validation may still occur), and a value of "only" just validates the style without creating it on the server (returning code 204 on successful validation and code 400 if validation fails).

validateStylePost.name: validate
validateStylePost.description: Whether or not to validate (or only validate) the style.  A value of "yes" validates the style before creating it on the server (returning code 201 on successful creation and code 400 if validation fails), a value of "no" creates the style without validation (although some validation may still occur), and a value of "only" just validates the style without creating it on the server (returning code 204 on successful validation and code 400 if validation fails).

validateStylePut.name: validate
validateStylePut.description: Whether or not to validate (or only validate) the style.  A value of "yes" validates the style before updating or creating it on the server (returning code 201 on successful creation, code 204 on successful update and code 400 if validation fails), a value of "no" updates or creates the style without validation (although some validation may still occur), and a value of "only" just validates the style without updating or creating it on the server (returning code 204 on successful validation and code 400 if validation fails).

Location.description: The URI of the new resource.

collection.description: A collection available in this data store.

collections.description: The set of collections available in this data store.

conformance.description: The set of OGC API conformance classes that are supported for this data store.

domainSet.description: The domain set of a coverage.

landingPage.description: The OGC API landing page for this data store.

map.description: A metadata document describing the map layers and map tiles that are available for the specified collection.

rangeType.description: The range type of a coverage.

sourceImage.description: Metadata about a source image of a collection, including links to the actual source image file(s).

sourceImages.description: The set of source images of a collection.

style.description: A style in this data store.

styles.description: The set of styles available in this data store.

themes.description: The set of collections available in this data store, organized into a theme hierarchy (see OGC 18-045, section A.6).

tileMatrixSets.description: The tile-matrix sets available in this data store.

tiles.description: A metadata document describing available tilesets.

scopes.profile: requests access to the end-user's profile
scopes.email: requests access to the end-user's e-mail address

scopes.profile: requests access to the end-user's profile
scopes.email: requests access to the end-user's e-mail address

scopes.profile: requests access to the end-user's profile
scopes.email: requests access to the end-user's e-mail address
